thread.title: Arctic blizzard forces Icelandic football match to abandon after 70 minutes
thread.title_full: Arctic blizzard forces Icelandic football match to abandon after 70 minutes

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Arctic blizzard forces Icelandic football match to abandon after 70 minutes
text:
Arctic blizzard forces Icelandic football match to abandon after 70 minutes Fram were hosting top tier side Breidablik in the League Cup Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Shocking weather in Iceland causes match to be abandoned Share this video Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
An Icelandic football match was forced to abandon after 70 minutes when an especially fierce arctic blizzard took hold. 
It occurred when Fram of Reykjav√≠k hosted Breidablik in Iceland's League Cup on Thursday night. 
Breidablik, who ply their trade in Iceland's top tier, were 1-0 up against the hosts from the league below when Mother Nature struck hard. 
At first, the snowfall was just a gentle flurry. But things soon picked up and the snowfall raged into a full on storm. The referee brings play to a halt (Photo: @blikar_is/Twitter) Three players brave the blizzard (Photo: @blikar_is/Twitter) 
The referee was forced to abandon the game on 70 minutes. 
A few brave players stayed behind to see if the game would resume, but soon found themselves covered in snow. Like us on Facebook
